question.title: {"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "Do conservatives/Republicans actually believe liberals/Democrats are more racist against blacks, or is that a strategically deployed lie?", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}

answer.content:
{"sections": [{"spans": [{"text": "“Do conservatives/Republicans actually believe liberals/Democrats are more racist against blacks, or is that a strategically deployed lie?”", "modifiers": {"bold": true}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Zarrella-Fact rates this claim… Half-True.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "If we’re talking specifically about racism ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "against blacks", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " rather than all forms of racism, then it is undeniable that the lion’s share of ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "overt", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " racists are Republican (or at least more likely to vote GOP, regardless of ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "official", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " party affiliation). That is, there aren’t many Democratic Klansmen or any of the other sorts who would overtly and consciously speak against “n*gg*rs” or talk about how blacks need to “learn their place” or whatever.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "However, there are two forms of racism that are ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "vastly", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " more prevalent among Democrats and/or other progressives:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "“Benign” racism—Which is really more racist? The attitude which says (as Frederick Douglass did), “Blacks can succeed just as well as whites, if we just stop holding them down,” or the one which says, “Left to their own devices, blacks will never catch up to whites, so we have to give them special help in order to make them equal”?

Now, I’m not saying that ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "any", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " political stance which points out “systemic” racism is inherently racist—there are some valid points there. But the flip side of the anti-", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "white", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " racism which treats “whiteness” as an inherent and indelible mark of advantage and oppression is, ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "by basic logic", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": ", an attitude which treats “blackness” as an inherent and indelible marker of inferiority and victimhood. This is even true among some ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "black", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " progressives, but even more so among those paternalistic ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "white", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " progressives who see themselves as needing to dole out goodies to the poor, unfortunate blacks who otherwise could not compete in this white man’s world.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "Racial essentialism—the attitude which says, “If you’re not [X] then you’re not a ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "real", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " black man/woman.”

That is, a conservative may see a well-spoken, erudite black man and see him as a shining example of what black Americans can aspire to (yes, I’m aware that there’s arguably a subtle, diluted form of racism inherent in that attitude as well—not the point here). But many progressives (in this case ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "especially", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " many black progressives) will see that man as “talking white” and “conforming to the values of whiteness” and therefore not ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "really", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " black. A term I’ve heard (which I think is utterly hateful) is “Oreo”—black on the outside, white on the inside—and the other, of course, is “Uncle Tom”.

Even more than education or mannerisms, however, is politics… I’ve lost count of how many times I’ve seen a prominent black conservative pilloried as “not really black” or “a traitor to his race”—as though progressive political views are somehow a shibboleth for “real blackness”.

This ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "is racism", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": "—and it’s almost exclusive to the Left.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "ordered-list", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "And yes, I would argue that the latter two forms of racism are ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "worse", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " than whatever overt racism or implicit bias infects conservatism—because the latter two are ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "insidious", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": ": they make many blacks ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "collaborators", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " in their own discrimination.", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "horizontal-rule", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "I do want to make one more effort at clarity, however, because of the highly charged nature of the subject matter:", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}, {"spans": [{"text": "When I say, “X form of racism is [most common in / exclusive to] progressivism,” I ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "do not mean", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " that all or most progressives are guilty of it. I mean only that all or most people who ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "are", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " guilty of it are progressives. Just as I said at the outset—", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "most", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " conservatives are not overt racists, but ", "modifiers": {}}, {"text": "most", "modifiers": {"italic": true}}, {"text": " overt racists are conservatives (at least in terms of the colloquial political spectrum—whether they are “conservatives” in a proper political philosophy sense is a more complicated question).", "modifiers": {}}], "indent": 0, "quoted": false, "type": "plain", "is_rtl": false}]}
